titlestmt.titleproper: E. J. Parker Sage genealogical research materials 1935-1976
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: E. J. Parker Sage genealogical research materials
did.repository: The Historical Society of Pennsylvania 1300 Locust Street Philadelphia, PA 19107

bioghist.p: E. J. Parker Sage lived in Detroit and Pittsburgh.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of genealogical research materials related to the Sage family and allied families such as Brown, Hadley, and Parker. Materials include: notes on published and primary sources; correspondence with family members and libraries and archives; copies/transcripts of primary sources (deeds, wills); a few photographs; and photocopies of newspaper clippings.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
